page.title: 10HEALTH SERVICES IN N-E LEICS
page.content: Most local people are registered with a{general practioner}at Melton Mowbray Somerby or Billesdon.Transport is essential to reach any of the local surgeries.Accidents and emergency cases are taken to{Leicester Royal {Infirmary.}Doctors and the auxillary health services e.g. health visitors for under 5s,district nurses and midwives will call if they are required.Ambulances are provided to take patients to hospital for treatment. There are small{hospitals}in Melton and Oakham which provide{maternity and {geriatric care}for those patients who do not require the services of a consultant.They will perform operations of a non-complex nature there.All other patients must go into Leicester for treatment and consultations.
